intro: Acetosella schomburgkiana, commonly known as Schomburgk's sorrel, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
